postretirement benefit asset impairment southern company southern power and southern company gas goodwill southern company and southern company gas the acquisition method of accounting requires the asset acquired and liability assumed to be recorded at the date of acquisition at their respective estimated fair value the applicable registrant have recognized goodwill of the date of their acquisition residual over the fair value of the identifiable net asset acquired goodwill is tested for impairment at the reporting unit level on an annual basis in the fourth quarter of the year well on an interim basis event and change in circumstance occur including but not limited to significant change in operating performance the business climate legal or regulatory factor or planned sale or disposition of significant portion of the business reporting unit is the operating segment or business one level below the operating segment component if discrete financial information is prepared and regularly reviewed by management component are aggregated if they have similar economic characteristic part of the impairment test the applicable registrant may perform an initial qualitative assessment to determine whether it is more likely than not that the fair value of each reporting unit is le than it carrying amount before applying the quantitative goodwill impairment test if the applicable registrant elect to perform the qualitative assessment it evaluates relevant event and circumstance including but not limited to macroeconomic condition industry and market condition cost factor financial performance entity specific event and event specific to each reporting unit if the applicable registrant determines that it is more likely than not that the fair value of reporting unit is le than it carrying amount or it elect not to perform qualitative assessment it compare the fair value of the reporting unit to it carrying value to determine if the fair value is greater than it carrying value goodwill for southern company and southern company gas wa billion and billion respectively at december for it annual impairment test southern company gas performed the quantitative assessment and confirmed that the ii table of content index to financial statement combined management discussion and analysis continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reportfair value of all of it reporting unit with goodwill exceeded their carrying value for it and annual impairment test southern company gas performed the qualitative assessment and determined that it wa more likely than not that the fair value of all of it reporting unit with goodwill exceeded their carrying amount and therefore no quantitative assessment wa required for it annual impairment test for powersecure southern company performed the quantitative assessment which resulted in the fair value of goodwill at powersecure exceeding it carrying value in all year presented however southern company recorded goodwill impairment charge totaling million in result of it decision to sell certain powersecure business unit see note to the financial statement under southern company for the estimated fair value assigned to each class of asset acquired and liability assumed well asset life can significantly impact the applicable registrant result of operation fair value and useful life are determined based on among other factor the expected future period of benefit of the asset the various characteristic of the asset and projected cash flow the determination of an asset fair value and useful life involves management making certain estimate and because these estimate form the basis for the determination of whether or not an impairment charge should be recorded the applicable registrant consider these estimate to be critical accounting estimate see note to the financial statement under goodwill and other intangible asset and liability for additional information regarding the applicable registrant goodwill long lived asset southern company southern power and southern company gas the applicable registrant ass their other long lived asset for impairment whenever event or change in circumstance indicate that an asset carrying amount may not be recoverable if an indicator exists the asset is tested for recoverability by comparing the asset carrying value to the sum of the undiscounted expected future cash flow directly attributable to the asset use and eventual disposition if the estimate of undiscounted future cash flow is le than the carrying value of the asset the fair value of the asset is determined and loss is recorded equal to the difference between the carrying value and the fair value of the asset in addition when asset are identified held for sale an impairment loss is recognized to the extent the carrying value of the asset or asset group exceeds their fair value le cost to sell high degree of judgment is required in developing estimate related to these evaluation which are based on projection of various factor some of which have been quite volatile in recent year impairment of long lived asset of the traditional electric utility and natural gas distribution utility are generally related to specific regulatory disallowances southern power investment in long lived asset are primarily generation asset excluding the natural gas distribution utility southern company gas investment in long lived asset are primarily natural gas transportation and storage facility asset whether in service or under construction for southern power example of impairment indicator could include significant change in construction schedule current period loss combined with history of loss or projection of continuing loss significant decrease in market price the inability to remarket generating capacity for an extended period the unplanned termination of customer contract or the inability of customer to perform under the term of the contract for southern company gas example of impairment indicator could include but are not limited to significant change in the natural gas storage market construction schedule current period loss combined with history of loss or projection of continuing loss significant decrease in market price the inability to renew or extend customer contract or the inability of customer to perform under the term of the contract attrition rate or the inability to deploy development project the determination of the expected future cash flow generated from an asset an asset fair value information on recent asset impairment ii table of content index to financial statement combined management discussion and analysis continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reportrevenue recognition southern power southern power power sale transaction which include ppas are classified in one of four general category lease non derivative or normal sale derivative derivative designated cash flow hedge and derivative not designated hedge southern power revenue are dependent upon significant judgment used to determine the appropriate transaction classification which must be documented upon the inception of each contract the two category with the most judgment required for southern power are described further below lease transactionssouthern power considers the term of sale contract to determine whether it should be accounted for lease contract is or contains lease if the contract conveys the right to control the use of identified property plant or equipment for period of time in exchange for consideration if the contract meet the criterion for lease southern power performs further analysis to determine whether the lease is classified operating financing or sale type generally southern power power sale contract that are determined to be lease are accounted for operating lease and the capacity revenue is recognized on straight line basis over the term of the contract and is included in southern power operating revenue energy revenue and other contingent revenue are recognized in the period the energy is delivered or the service is rendered for those contract that are determined to be sale type lease capacity revenue are recognized by accounting for interest income on the net investment in the lease and are included in southern power operating revenue see note to the financial statement for additional information non derivative and normal sale derivative transactionsif the power sale contract is not classified lease southern power further considers whether the contract meet the definition of derivative if the contract doe meet the definition of derivative southern power will ass whether it can be designated normal sale contract the determination of whether contract can be designated normal sale contract requires judgment including whether the sale of electricity involves physical delivery in quantity within southern power available generating capacity and that the purchaser will take quantity expected to be used or sold in the normal course of business contract that do not meet the definition of derivative or are designated normal sale are accounted for executory contract for contract that have capacity charge the revenue is generally recognized in the period that it becomes billable revenue related to energy and ancillary service are recognized in the period the energy is delivered or the service is rendered see note to the financial statement for additional information acquisition accounting southern power southern power may acquire generation asset part of it overall growth strategy at the time of an acquisition southern power will ass if these asset and activity meet the definition of business for acquisition that meet the definition of business the purchase price including any contingent consideration is allocated based on the fair value of the identifiable asset acquired and liability assumed including any intangible asset primarily related to acquired ppas asset acquired that do not meet the definition of business are accounted for an asset acquisition the purchase price of each asset acquisition is allocated based on the relative fair value of asset acquired determining the fair value of asset acquired and liability assumed requires management judgment and southern power may engage independent valuation expert to assist in this process fair value are determined by using market participant assumption and typically include the timing and amount of future cash flow incurred construction cost the nature of acquired contract discount rate power market price and expected asset life any due diligence or transition cost incurred by southern power for potential or successful acquisition are expensed incurred see note to the financial statement for additional fair value information and note to the financial statement for additional information on recent acquisition variable interest entity southern power southern power enters into partnership with varying ownership structure upon entering into these arrangement membership interest and other variable interest are evaluated to determine if the legal entity is vie if the legal entity is vie southern power will ass if it ha both the power to direct the activity of the vie that most significantly impact the vie economic performance and the obligation to absorb loss or the right to receive benefit from the vie that could potentially be significant to the vie making it the primary beneficiary making this determination may require significant management judgment if southern power is the primary beneficiary and is considered to have controlling ownership the asset liability and result of operation of the entity are consolidated if southern power is not the primary beneficiary the legal entity is generally accounted for under the equity method of accounting southern power reconsiders it conclusion to whether the legal entity is ii table of content index to financial statement combined management discussion and analysis continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reporta vie and whether it is the primary beneficiary for event that impact the right of variable interest such ownership change in membership interest southern power ha controlling ownership in certain legal entity for which the contractual provision represent profit sharing arrangement because the allocation of cash distribution and tax benefit are not based on fixed ownership percentage for these arrangement the noncontrolling interest is accounted for under balance sheet approach utilizing the hlbv method the hlbv method calculates each partner share of income based on the change in net equity the partner can legally claim in hlbv at the end of the period compared to the beginning of the period contingent obligation all registrant the registrant are subject to number of federal and state law and regulation well other factor and condition that subject them to environmental litigation and other risk see future earnings potential herein and note and to the financial statement for more information regarding certain of these contingency the registrant periodically evaluate their exposure to such risk and record reserve for those matter where non tax related loss is considered probable and reasonably estimable the adequacy of reserve can be significantly affected by external event or condition that can be unpredictable thus the ultimate outcome of such matter could materially affect the result of operation cash flow or financial condition of the registrant recently issued accounting standardsin march the fasb issued asu reference rate reform topic facilitation of the effect of reference rate reform on financial reporting asu providing temporary guidance to ease the potential burden in accounting for reference rate reform primarily resulting from the discontinuation of libor which began phasing out on december the amendment in asu are elective and apply to all entity that have contract hedging relationship and other transaction that reference libor or another reference rate expected to be discontinued the new guidance simplifies accounting analysis under current gaap for contract modification ii simplifies the assessment of hedge effectiveness and allows hedging relationship affected by reference rate reform to continue and iii allows one time election to sell or transfer debt security classified held to maturity that reference rate affected by reference rate reform an entity may elect to apply the amendment prospectively from march through december by accounting topic the registrant have elected to apply the amendment to modification of debt arrangement that meet the scope of asu the registrant currently reference libor for certain debt and hedging arrangement in addition certain provision in ppas at southern power include reference to libor contract language ha been or is expected to be incorporated into each of these agreement to address the transition to an alternative rate for agreement that will be in place at the transition date while no material impact are expected from modification to the arrangement and effective hedging relationship are expected to continue the registrant will continue to evaluate the provision of asu and the impact of transitioning to an alternative rate and the ultimate outcome of the transition can not be determined at this time see financial condition price of electricity the traditional electric operating company and certain of the natural gas distribution utility manage fuel hedging program implemented per the guideline of their respective state pscs or other applicable state regulatory agency to hedge the impact of market fluctuation in natural gas price for customer mississippi power also manages wholesale fuel hedging program under agreement with it wholesale customer because energy from southern power facility is primarily sold under long term ppas with tolling agreement and provision shifting substantially all of the responsibility for fuel cost to the counterparties southern power exposure to market volatility in commodity fuel price and price of electricity is generally limited however southern power ha been and may continue to be exposed to market volatility in energy related commodity price result of uncontracted generating capacity to mitigate residual risk relative to movement in electricity price the extent financial hedge contract for natural gas purchase however significant portion of contract are priced at market certain of southern company gas non regulated operation primarily sequent until it the lowest exposure in the non peak summer month and the highest exposure in the peak winter month marketer are responsible for the retail sale of natural gas to end use customer in georgia the provision of atlanta gas light tariff allow atlanta gas light to obtain credit security support in an amount equal to minimum of two time marketer highest month estimated bill from atlanta gas light for the four largest marketer based on customer count which includes southstar accounted for of southern company gas operating revenue and of operating revenue for southern company gas gas letter of credit surety bond from acceptable issuer and corporate guarantee from investment grade entity southern company gas review the adequacy of credit support coverage credit rating profile of credit support provider and payment status of each marketer southern company gas belief that adequate policy and procedure are in place to properly quantify manage and report on atlanta gas light gas light assigns this capacity to marketer in the event that marketer fails to pay the interstate pipeline for the capacity the interstate pipeline would likely seek repayment from atlanta gas light accounting firmto the stockholder and the board of director of the southern company and subsidiary companiesopinions on the financial statement and internal control over financial reportingwe have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheet of the southern company and subsidiary company southern company of december and the related consolidated statement of income comprehensive income stockholder equity and cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december and the related note collectively referred to the financial statement also have audited southern company internal control over financial reporting of december based on criterion established in internal control integrated framework issued by the committee of sponsoring organization of the treadway commission coso in our opinion the financial statement referred to above present fairly in all material respect the financial position of southern company of december and and the result of it operation and it cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december in conformity with accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america also in our opinion southern company maintained in all material respect effective internal control over financial reporting of december based on criterion established in internal control integrated framework issued by coso basis for opinionssouthern company management is responsible for these financial statement for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for it assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting included in the accompanying management report on internal control over financial reporting our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statement and an opinion on southern company internal control over financial reporting based on our audit we are public accounting firm registered with the public company accounting oversight board united state pcaob and are required to be independent with respect to southern company in accordance with the federal security law and the applicable rule and regulation of the security and exchange commission and the pcaob we conducted our audit in accordance with the standard of the pcaob those standard require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statement are free of material misstatement whether due to error or fraud and whether effective internal control over financial reporting wa maintained in all material respect our audit of the consolidated financial statement included performing procedure to ass the risk of material misstatement of the financial statement whether due to error or fraud and performing procedure to respond to those risk such procedure included examining on test basis evidence regarding the amount and disclosure in the financial statement our audit also included evaluating the accounting principle used and significant estimate made by management well evaluating the overall presentation of the financial statement our audit of internal control over financial reporting included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting assessing the risk that material weakness exists and testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk our audit also included performing such other procedure we considered necessary in the circumstance we believe that our audit provide reasonable basis for our opinion definition and limitation of internal control over financial reportinga company internal control over financial reporting is process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statement for external purpose in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle company internal control over financial reporting includes those policy and procedure that pertain to the maintenance of record that in reasonable detail accurately and fairly reflect the transaction and disposition of the asset of the company provide reasonable assurance that transaction are recorded necessary to permit preparation of financial statement in accordance with generally accepted accounting principle and that receipt and expenditure of the company are being made only in accordance with authorization of management and director of the company and provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition use or disposition of the company asset that could have material effect on the financial statement because of it inherent limitation internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatement also projection of any evaluation of effectiveness to future period are subject to the risk that control may become inadequate because of change in condition or that the degree of compliance with the policy or procedure may deteriorate ii table of content index to financial statementscritical audit mattersthe critical audit matter communicated below are matter arising from the current period audit of the financial statement that were communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee of southern company board of director and that relate to account or disclosure that are material to the financial statement and involved our especially challenging subjective or complex judgment the communication of critical audit matter doe not alter in any way our opinion on the financial statement taken whole and we are not by communicating the critical audit matter below providing separate opinion on the critical audit matter or on the account or disclosure to which they relate impact of rate regulation on the financial statement refer to note summary of significant accounting policy regulatory asset and liability and note regulatory matter to the financial statementscritical audit matter descriptionsouthern company traditional electric operating company and natural gas distribution utility the regulated utility subsidiary which represent approximately of southern company consolidated operating revenue for the year ended december and of it consolidated total asset at december are subject to rate regulation by their respective state public service commission or other applicable state regulatory agency and wholesale regulation by the federal energy regulatory commission collectively the commission management ha determined that the regulated utility subsidiary meet the requirement under accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america to utilize specialized rule to account for the effect of rate regulation in the preparation of it financial statement accounting for the economics of rate regulation impact multiple financial statement line item and disclosure including but not limited to property plant and equipment other regulatory asset other regulatory liability other cost of removal obligation deferred charge and credit related to income tax under and over recovered regulatory clause revenue operating revenue operation and maintenance expense and depreciation and amortization the commission set the rate the regulated utility subsidiary are permitted to charge customer rate are determined and approved in regulatory proceeding based on an analysis of the applicable regulated utility subsidiary cost to provide utility service and return on and recovery of it investment in the utility business current and future regulatory decision can have an impact on the recovery of cost the rate of return earned on investment and the timing and amount of asset to be recovered by rate the commission regulation of rate is premised on the full recovery of prudently incurred cost and reasonable rate of return on invested capital while southern company regulated utility subsidiary expect to recover cost from customer through regulated rate there is risk that the commission will not approve full recovery of the cost of providing utility service or full recovery of all amount invested in the utility business and reasonable return on that investment we identified the impact of rate regulation critical audit matter due to the significant judgment made by management to support it assertion about impacted account balance and disclosure asset retirement cost property damage reserve and remaining net book value of retired asset and the high degree of subjectivity involved in assessing the potential impact of future regulatory order on the financial statement management judgment include assessing the likelihood of recovery in future rate of statement the ultimate recovery of georgia power company georgia power investment in the construction of plant vogtle unit and is subject to multiple uncertainty such uncertainty include the potential impact of future decision by georgia power regulator particularly the georgia public service commission and potential action by the co owner of the vogtle project in addition georgia power ability to meet it cost and schedule forecast could impact it ability to fully recover it investment in the project while the project is not subject to cost cap georgia power cost and schedule forecast are subject to numerous uncertainty which could impact cost recovery including ongoing or future challenge with management of contractor and vendor subcontractor performance supervision of craft labor and related productivity particularly in the installation of electrical mechanical and instrumentation and control commodity ability to attract and retain craft labor and or related cost escalation and procurement and related installation new challenge may arise particularly unit and move into initial testing and start up which may result in required engineering change or remediation related to plant system structure or component some of which are based on new technology that only within the last few year began initial operation in the global nuclear industry at this scale the ongoing and potential future challenge described above may change the projected schedule and estimated cost in addition the continuing effect of the covid pandemic could further disrupt or delay construction management well georgia public service commission decision in future regulatory proceeding after considering the significant level of uncertainty that exists regarding the future recoverability of these cost since the ultimate outcome of these matter is subject to the outcome of future assessment by management well georgia psc decision in future regulatory proceeding georgia power recorded pre evaluation monitoring and disclosure of matter related to the construction and ultimate cost recovery of plant vogtle unit and we involved construction specialist to assist in our evaluation of the reasonableness of the projected in service date for plant vogtle unit and and georgia power process for on going evaluation and monitoring of the construction schedule and to ass the disclosure of the contractor independent regulatory monitor and co owner of the project to evaluate and monitor construction status and identify cost and schedule challenge ii table of content index to financial risk and uncertainty to the achievement of such forecast we inspected regulatory filing and transcript of georgia public service commission hearing regarding the construction and cost recovery of plant vogtle unit and to identify potential challenge to the recovery of georgia power construction cost and to evaluate the disclosure with respect to such uncertainty we inquired of georgia power and southern company management and internal and external legal counsel regarding any potential legal action or issue arising from project construction or issue involving the co owner of the project ultimate cost recovery of plant vogtle unit and we compared the financial statement disclosure relating to this matter to the information gathered through the conduct of all our procedure to evaluate companyopinion on the financial statementswe have audited the accompanying balance sheet of alabama power company alabama power wholly owned subsidiary of the southern company of december and the related statement of income comprehensive income common stockholder equity and cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december and the related note collectively referred to the financial statement in our opinion the financial statement present fairly in all material respect the financial position of alabama power of december and and the result of it operation and it cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december in conformity with accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america basis for opinionthese financial statement are the responsibility of alabama power management our responsibility is to express an opinion on alabama power financial statement based on our audit we are public accounting firm registered with the public company accounting oversight board united state pcaob and are required to be independent with respect to alabama power in accordance with the federal security law and the applicable rule and regulation of the security and exchange commission and the pcaob we conducted our audit in accordance with the standard of the pcaob those standard require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statement are free of material misstatement whether due to error or fraud alabama power is not required to have nor were we engaged to perform an audit of it internal control over financial reporting part of our audit we are required to obtain an understanding of internal control over financial reporting but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of alabama power internal control over financial reporting accordingly we express no such opinion our audit included performing procedure to ass the risk of material misstatement of the financial statement whether due to error or fraud and performing procedure that respond to those risk such procedure included examining on test basis evidence regarding the amount and disclosure in the financial statement our audit also included evaluating the accounting principle used and significant estimate made by management well evaluating the overall presentation of the financial statement we believe that our audit provide reasonable basis for our opinion critical audit matterthe critical audit matter communicated below is matter arising from the current period audit of the financial statement that wa communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee of southern company board of director and that relates to account or disclosure that are material to the financial statement and involved our especially challenging subjective or complex judgment the communication of critical audit matter doe not alter in any way our opinion on the financial statement taken whole and we are not by communicating the critical audit matter below providing separate opinion on the critical audit matter or on the account or disclosure to which it relates impact of rate regulation on the financial statement refer to note summary of significant accounting policy regulatory asset and liability and note regulatory matter alabama power to the financial statementscritical audit matter descriptionalabama power is subject to retail rate regulation by the alabama public service commission and wholesale regulation by the federal energy regulatory commission collectively the commission management ha determined that it meet the requirement under accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america to utilize specialized rule to account for the effect of rate regulation in the preparation of it financial statement accounting for the economics of rate regulation impact multiple financial statement line item and disclosure including but not limited to property plant and equipment other regulatory asset other regulatory liability other cost of removal obligation deferred charge and credit related to income tax under and over recovered regulatory clause revenue operating revenue operation and maintenance expense and depreciation and amortization the commission set the rate alabama power is permitted to charge customer rate are determined and approved in regulatory proceeding based on an analysis of alabama power cost to provide utility service and return on and recovery of it investment in the utility business current and future regulatory decision can have an impact on the recovery of cost the rate of return earned on investment and the timing and amount of asset to be recovered by rate the commission regulation of rate is premised on the full recovery of prudently incurred cost and reasonable rate of return on invested capital while alabama power expects to recover cost from customer through regulated rate there is risk that the commission will not approve ii table of content index to financial statementsfull recovery of the cost of providing utility service or full recovery of all amount invested in the utility business and reasonable return on that investment we identified the impact of rate regulation critical audit matter due to the significant judgment made by management to the financial statementswe have audited the accompanying balance sheet of mississippi power company mississippi power wholly owned subsidiary of the southern company of december and the related statement of income comprehensive income common stockholder equity and cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december and the related note collectively referred to the financial statement in our opinion the financial statement present fairly in all material respect the financial position of mississippi power of december and and the result of it operation and it cash flow for each of the three year in the period ended december in conformity with accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america basis for opinionthese financial statement are the responsibility of mississippi power management our responsibility is to express an opinion on mississippi power financial statement based on our audit we are public accounting firm registered with the public company accounting oversight board united state pcaob and are required to be independent with respect to mississippi power in accordance with the federal security law and the applicable rule and regulation of the security and exchange commission and the pcaob we conducted our audit in accordance with the standard of the pcaob those standard require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statement are free of material misstatement whether due to error or fraud mississippi power is not required to have nor were we engaged to perform an audit of it internal control over financial reporting part of our audit we are required to obtain an understanding of internal control over financial reporting but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of mississippi power internal control over financial reporting accordingly we express no such opinion our audit included performing procedure to ass the risk of material misstatement of the financial statement whether due to error or fraud and performing procedure that respond to those risk such procedure included examining on test basis evidence regarding the amount and disclosure in the financial statement our audit also included evaluating the accounting principle used and significant estimate made by management well evaluating the overall presentation of the financial statement we believe that our audit provide reasonable basis for our opinion critical audit matterthe critical audit matter communicated below is matter arising from the current period audit of the financial statement that wa communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee of southern company board of director and that relates to account or disclosure that are material to the financial statement and involved our especially challenging subjective or complex judgment the communication of critical audit matter doe not alter in any way our opinion on the financial statement taken whole and we are not by communicating the critical audit matter below providing separate opinion on the critical audit matter or on the account or disclosure to which it relates impact of rate regulation on the financial statement refer to note summary of significant accounting policy regulatory asset and liability and note regulatory matter mississippi power to the financial statementscritical audit matter descriptionmississippi power is subject to retail rate regulation by the mississippi public service commission and wholesale regulation by the federal energy regulatory commission collectively the commission management ha determined that it meet the requirement under accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america to utilize specialized rule to account for the effect of rate regulation in the preparation of it financial statement accounting for the economics of rate regulation impact multiple financial statement line item and disclosure including but not limited to property plant and equipment other regulatory asset other regulatory liability regulatory asset asset retirement obligation other cost of removal obligation deferred charge and credit related to income tax under and over recovered regulatory clause revenue operating revenue operation and maintenance expense and depreciation and amortization the commission set the rate mississippi power is permitted to charge customer rate are determined and approved in regulatory proceeding based on an analysis of mississippi power cost to provide utility service and return on and recovery of it investment in the utility business current and future regulatory decision can have an impact on the recovery of cost the rate of return earned on investment and the timing and amount of asset to be recovered by rate the commission regulation of rate is premised on the full recovery of prudently incurred cost and reasonable rate of return on invested capital while mississippi power expects to recover cost from customer through regulated rate there is risk that the commission will not ii table of content index to financial statementsapprove full recovery of the cost of providing utility service or full recovery of all amount invested in the utility business and reasonable return on that investment we identified the impact of rate regulation critical audit matter due to the significant judgment made by management to support it assertion about impacted account balance and disclosure asset retirement cost property damage reserve and the remaining net book value of retired asset and the high degree of subjectivity involved in assessing the potential impact of future regulatory order on the financial statement management judgment include assessing the likelihood of recovery in future rate of incurred cost disallowance of part of the cost of recently completed plant and or refund to customer given that management accounting judgment are based on assumption about the outcome of future decision by the commission auditing these judgment required specialized knowledge of accounting for rate regulation and the rate setting process due to it inherent complexity and significant auditor judgment to evaluate management estimate and the subjectivity of audit evidence how the critical audit matter wa addressed in the auditour audit procedure related to the uncertainty of future decision by the commission included the following among others we read relevant regulatory order issued by the commission for mississippi power regulatory statute interpretation procedural memorandum filing made by intervenor and other publicly available information to ass the likelihood of recovery in future rate or of future reduction in rate based on precedent of the commission treatment of similar cost under similar circumstance we evaluated the external information and compared it to management recorded regulatory asset and liability balance for completeness for regulatory matter in process we inspected filing with the commission by mississippi power and other interested party that may impact mississippi power future rate for any evidence that might contradict management assertion we evaluated regulatory filing for any evidence that intervenor are challenging full recovery of the cost of any capital project we tested selected cost included in the capitalized project cost for completeness and accuracy we obtained representation from management regarding probability of recovery for regulatory asset or refund or future reduction in rate for regulatory liability to ass management assertion that amount are probable of recovery refund or future reduction in rate we evaluated mississippi power disclosure united state of america basis for opinionthese financial statement are the responsibility of southern power management our responsibility is to express an opinion on southern power financial statement based on our audit we are public accounting firm registered with the public company accounting oversight board united state pcaob and are required to be independent with respect to southern power in accordance with the federal security law and the applicable rule and regulation of the security and exchange commission and the pcaob we conducted our audit in accordance with the standard of the pcaob those standard require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statement are free of material misstatement whether due to error or fraud southern power is not required to have nor were we engaged to perform an audit of it internal control over financial reporting part of our audit we are required to obtain an understanding of internal such procedure included examining on test basis evidence regarding the amount and disclosure in the financial statement our audit also included evaluating the accounting principle used and significant estimate made by management well evaluating the overall presentation of the financial statement we believe that our audit provide reasonable basis for our opinion critical audit matterthe critical company board of director and that relates to account or disclosure that are material to the financial statement and involved our especially challenging subjective or complex judgment the communication of critical audit matter doe not alter in any way our opinion on the financial statement taken whole and we are not by communicating the critical audit matter below providing separate opinion on the critical audit matter or on the account or disclosure to which is relates income loss allocation to noncontrolling interest refer to note and to the financial statementscritical audit matter descriptionsouthern power ha entered into number of tax equity partnership arrangement wherein they agree to sell of class of membership interest class in an entity to noncontrolling investor in exchange for cash contribution while retaining control of the entity through separate class of membership interest class the agreement for these partnership give different right and priority to their owner in term of cash distribution tax attribute allocation and partnership income or loss allocation these provision make the conventional equity method of accounting where an investor applies it percentage ownership interest to the investee net income under generally accepted accounting principle to determine the investor share of earnings or loss difficult to apply therefore southern power us the hypothetical liquidation at book value hlbv accounting method to account for these partnership arrangement the hlbv accounting method calculates each partner share of income or loss based on the change in net equity the partner can legally claim at the end of the reporting period compared to the beginning of the reporting period the application of the hlbv accounting method by southern power required significant consideration of the allocation between southern power and the noncontrolling investor over the life of the agreement and the liquidation provision of the agreement to determine the appropriate allocation of income or loss between the party the determination of the appropriate amount of allocated partnership income or loss to noncontrolling interest using the hlbv accounting method required increased audit effort and specialized skill and knowledge including evaluation of the term of the agreement and consideration of the appropriateness of the hlbv model based on the provision of the agreement ii table of content index to financial statementshow the critical audit matter wa addressed in the auditour audit procedure included the following among others for agreement that result in potentially material allocation of partnership income or loss we read the agreement to understand the liquidation provision and the provision governing the allocation of benefit we evaluated the hlbv model utilized by management to determine whether the model accurately reflect the allocation of income or loss and tax attribute in accordance with the liquidation provision and allocation term defined in the agreement well whether the input in the model are accurate and complete deloitte touche llpatlanta georgiafebruary have served southern power auditor since regulatory asset and liability and note regulatory matter southern company gas to the financial statementscritical audit matter descriptionsouthern company gas natural gas distribution utility the regulated utility subsidiary which represent approximately of southern company gas consolidated revenue are subject to rate regulation in georgia illinois tennessee and virginia by their respective state public service commission or other applicable state regulatory agency collectively the commission management ha determined it meet the requirement under accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america to prepare it financial statement applying the specialized rule to account for the effect of regulation accounting for the economics of rate regulation impact multiple financial statement line item and disclosure including but not limited to ii table of content index to financial statementsproperty plant and equipment other regulatory asset other regulatory liability other cost of removal obligation deferred charge and credit related to income tax operating revenue other operation and maintenance expense and depreciation and amortization the commission set the rate the regulated utility subsidiary are permitted to charge customer rate are determined and approved in regulatory proceeding based on an analysis of the applicable regulated utility subsidiary cost to provide utility service and return on and recovery of it investment in the utility business current and future regulatory decision can have an impact on the recovery of cost the rate of return earned on investment and the timing and amount of asset to be recovered by rate the commission regulation of rate is premised on the full recovery of prudently incurred cost and reasonable rate of return on invested capital while southern company gas regulated utility subsidiary expect to recover cost from customer through regulated rate there is risk that the commission will not approve full recovery of the cost of providing utility service or full recovery of all amount invested in the utility business and reasonable return on that investment we identified the impact of rate regulation critical audit matter due to the significant judgment made by management to support it assertion about impacted account balance and disclosure and the high degree of subjectivity involved in assessing the impact of future regulatory order on the financial statement management judgment include assessing the likelihood of recovery in future rate of incurred cost disallowance of part of the cost of recently completed plant or plant under construction and or refund to customer given that management accounting judgment are based on assumption about the outcome of future decision by the commission auditing these judgment required specialized knowledge of accounting for rate regulation and the rate setting process due to it inherent complexity and significant auditor judgment to evaluate management estimate and the subjectivity of audit evidence how the critical audit matter wa addressed in the auditour audit procedure related to the uncertainty of future decision by the commission included the following among others we tested the effectiveness of management control over the evaluation of the likelihood of the recovery in future rate of cost incurred property plant and equipment and deferred regulatory asset and refund or future reduction in rate that should be reported regulatory liability we also tested the effectiveness of management control over the initial recognition of amount property plant and equipment regulatory asset or liability and the monitoring and evaluation of regulatory development that may affect the likelihood of recovering cost in future rate or of future reduction in rate we read relevant regulatory order issued by the commission for southern company gas regulated utility subsidiary in georgia illinois tennessee and virginia regulatory statute interpretation procedural memorandum filing made by intervenor and other publicly available information to ass the likelihood of recovery in future rate or of future reduction in rate based on precedent of the commission treatment of similar cost under similar circumstance we evaluated the external information and compared it to management recorded regulatory asset and liability balance for completeness for regulatory matter in process we inspected filing with the commission by the regulated utility subsidiary and other interested party that may impact the regulated utility subsidiary future rate for any evidence that might contradict management assertion we evaluated regulatory filing for any evidence that intervenor are challenging full recovery of statementspostretirement benefit obligationat december the company postretirement benefit obligation wa million and the company plan asset were million resulting in net asset position of million described in note of the consolidated financial statement the postretirement benefit obligation is primarily based on actuarial calculation which include various significant assumption we identified the company estimate of the postretirement benefit obligation critical audit matter auditing the postretirement benefit obligation required complex auditor judgment due to the highly judgmental nature of the actuarial assumption used in the calculation which include the discount rate and the expected return on plan asset these assumption had significant effect on the postretirement benefit obligation calculation the primary procedure we performed to address this critical audit matter included comparing the actuarial assumption used by management with historical trend and evaluating the change in the postretirement benefit obligation from prior year due to change in assumption evaluating the appropriateness of management methodology for determining the discount rate that reflects the maturity and duration of the benefit payment evaluating the expected return on plan asset by assessing whether management assumption were consistent with range of return for portfolio of comparative investment that wa determined based on publicly available information emphasis of matter significant transaction with related partiesas discussed in note to the consolidated financial statement the annual summary of significant accounting policiesgeneralsouthern company is the parent company of three traditional electric operating company well southern power southern company gas sc southern linc southern holding southern nuclear powersecure and other direct and indirect subsidiary the traditional electric operating company alabama power georgia power and mississippi power are vertically integrated utility providing electric service in three southeastern state southern power develops construct acquires owns and manages power generation asset including renewable energy project and sell electricity at market based rate in the wholesale market southern company gas distributes natural gas through natural gas distribution utility including nicor gas illinois atlanta gas light georgia virginia natural gas and chattanooga gas tennessee southern company gas is also involved in several other complementary business including gas pipeline investment and gas marketing service prior to the sale of sequent on july these business also included wholesale gas service sc the system service company provides at cost specialized service to southern company and it subsidiary company southern linc provides digital wireless communication for use by southern company and it subsidiary company and also market these service to the public and provides fiber optic service within the southeast southern holding is an intermediate holding company subsidiary southern nuclear operates and provides service to the southern company system nuclear power plant including alabama power plant farley and georgia power plant hatch and plant vogtle unit and and is currently managing construction and start up of plant vogtle unit and which are co owned by georgia power powersecure develops distributed energy and resilience solution and deploys microgrids for commercial industrial governmental and utility customer see note for information regarding the sale of sequent the registrant financial statement reflect investment in subsidiary on consolidated basis intercompany transaction have been eliminated in consolidation the equity method is used for investment in entity in which registrant ha significant influence but doe not have control and for vies where registrant ha an equity investment but is not the primary beneficiary southern power ha controlling ownership in certain legal entity for which the contractual provision represent profit sharing arrangement because the allocation of cash distribution and tax benefit are not based on fixed ownership percentage for these arrangement the noncontrolling interest is accounted for under balance sheet approach utilizing the hlbv method the hlbv method calculates each partner share of income based on the change in net equity the partner can legally claim in hlbv at the end of the period compared to the beginning of the period see variable interest entity herein and note for additional information the traditional electric operating company southern power certain subsidiary of southern company gas and certain other subsidiary are subject to regulation by the ferc and the traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility are also subject to regulation by their respective state pscs or other applicable state regulatory agency such the respective financial statement of the applicable registrant reflect the effect of rate regulation in accordance with gaap and comply with the accounting policy and practice prescribed by relevant state pscs or other applicable state regulatory agency the preparation of financial statement in conformity with gaap requires the use of estimate and the actual result may differ from those estimate certain prior year data presented in the financial statement have been reclassified to conform to the current year presentation these reclassification had no impact on the registrant result of operation financial position or cash flow recently adopted accounting standardsin march the fasb issued asu reference rate reform topic facilitation of the effect of reference rate reform on financial reporting asu providing temporary guidance to ease the potential burden in accounting for reference rate reform primarily resulting from the discontinuation of libor which began phasing out on december the amendment in asu are elective and apply to all entity that have contract hedging relationship and other transaction that reference libor or another reference rate expected to be discontinued the new guidance simplifies accounting analysis under current gaap for contract modification ii simplifies the assessment of hedge effectiveness and allows hedging relationship affected by reference rate reform to continue and iii allows one time election to sell or transfer debt security classified held to maturity that reference rate affected by reference rate reform an entity may elect to apply the amendment prospectively from march through december by accounting topic the registrant have elected to apply the amendment to modification of debt arrangement that meet the scope of asu the registrant currently reference libor for certain debt and hedging arrangement in addition certain provision in ppas at southern power include reference to libor contract language ha been or is expected to be incorporated into each of these agreement to address the transition to an alternative rate for agreement that will be in place at the transition date while no material impact are expected from modification to the regulatory asset and liabilitiesthe traditional electric operating company and the natural gas distribution utility are subject to accounting requirement for the effect of rate regulation regulatory asset represent probable future revenue associated with certain cost that are expected to be recovered from customer through the ratemaking process regulatory liability represent cost recovered that are expected to be incurred in the future or probable future reduction in revenue associated with amount that are expected to be credited to customer through the ratemaking process in the event that portion of traditional electric operating company or natural gas distribution utility operation is no longer subject to applicable accounting rule for rate regulation such company would be required to write off to income or reclassify to ii table of content index to financial statementscombined note to financial statement continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reportaoci related regulatory asset and liability that are not specifically recoverable through regulated rate in addition the traditional electric operating company or the natural gas distribution utility would be required to determine if any impairment to other asset including plant exists and write down the asset if impaired to their fair value all regulatory asset and liability are to be reflected in rate see note for additional information including detail of regulatory asset and liability reflected in the balance sheet for southern company the traditional electric operating company and southern company gas revenuesthe registrant generate revenue from variety of source which are accounted for under various revenue accounting guidance including revenue from contract with customer lease derivative and regulatory accounting see note and for additional information traditional electric operating companiesthe majority of the revenue of the traditional electric operating company are generated from contract with retail electric customer these revenue generated from the integrated service to deliver electricity when and if called upon by the customer are recognized single performance obligation satisfied over time at tariff rate and electricity is delivered to the customer during the month unbilled revenue related to retail sale are accrued at the end of each fiscal period retail rate may include provision to adjust revenue for fluctuation in fuel cost fuel hedging the energy component of purchased power cost and certain other cost revenue are adjusted for difference between these actual cost and amount billed in current regulated rate under or over recovered regulatory clause revenue are recorded in the balance sheet and are recovered from or returned to customer respectively through adjustment to the billing factor see note for additional information regarding regulatory matter of the traditional electric operating company wholesale capacity revenue from ppas are recognized in amount billable under the contract term energy and other revenue are generally recognized service are provided the contract for capacity and energy in wholesale ppa have multiple performance obligation where the contract total transaction price is allocated to each performance obligation based on the standalone selling price the standalone selling price is primarily determined by the price charged to customer for the specific good or service transferred with the performance obligation generally the traditional electric operating company recognize revenue the performance obligation are satisfied over time electricity is delivered to the customer or generation capacity is available to the customer for both retail and wholesale revenue the traditional electric operating company have elected to recognize revenue for their sale of electricity and capacity using the invoice practical expedient they generally have right to consideration in an amount that corresponds directly with the value to the customer of the performance completed to date and that may be invoiced payment for good and service rendered is typically due in the subsequent month following satisfaction of the registrant performance obligation southern powersouthern power sell capacity and energy at rate specified under contractual term in long term ppas these ppas are accounted for lease non derivative or normal sale derivative capacity revenue from ppas classified operating lease are recognized on straight line basis over the term of the agreement energy revenue are recognized in the period the energy is delivered capacity revenue from ppas classified sale type lease are recognized by accounting for interest income on the net investment in the lease southern power non lease contract commonly include capacity and energy which are considered separate performance obligation in these contract the total transaction price is allocated to each performance obligation based on the standalone selling price the standalone selling price is primarily determined by the price charged to customer for the specific good or service transferred with the performance obligation generally southern power recognizes revenue the performance obligation are satisfied over time electricity is delivered to the customer or generation capacity is made available to the customer southern power generally ha right to consideration in an amount that corresponds directly with the value to the customer of the performance completed to date and may recognize revenue in the amount to which the entity ha right to invoice payment for good and service rendered is typically due in the subsequent month following satisfaction of southern power performance obligation when multiple contract exist with the same counterparty the revenue from each contract are accounted for separate arrangement ii table of content index to financial statementscombined note to financial statement continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reportsouthern power may also enter into contract to sell short term capacity in the wholesale electricity market these sale are generally classified mark to market derivative and net unrealized gain and loss on such contract are recorded in wholesale revenue see note and financial instrument herein for additional information southern company gasgas distribution operationssouthern company gas record revenue when good or service are provided to customer those revenue are based on rate approved by the state regulatory agency of the natural gas distribution utility atlanta gas light operates in deregulated natural gas market whereby marketer rather than traditional utility sell natural gas to end use customer in georgia and handle customer billing function required by the georgia psc atlanta gas light bill marketer in equal monthly installment for each residential commercial and industrial end use customer distribution cost well for capacity cost utilizing seasonal rate design for the calculation of each residential end use customer annual straight fixed variable charge which reflects the historic volumetric usage pattern for the entire residential class the majority of the revenue of southern company gas are generated from contract with natural gas distribution customer revenue from this integrated service to deliver gas when and if called upon by the customer are recognized single performance obligation satisfied over time and are recognized at tariff rate gas is delivered to the customer during the month the standalone selling price is primarily determined by the price charged to customer for the specific good or service transferred with the performance obligation generally southern company gas recognizes revenue the performance obligation are satisfied over time natural gas is delivered to the customer the performance obligation related to wholesale gas service are satisfied and revenue is recognized at point in time when natural gas is delivered to the customer southern company gas ha elected to recognize revenue for sale of gas using the invoice practical expedient it generally ha right to consideration in an amount that corresponds directly with the value to the customer of the performance completed to date and that may be invoiced payment for good and service rendered is typically due in the subsequent month following satisfaction of southern company gas performance obligation with the exception of atlanta gas light the natural gas distribution utility have rate structure that include volumetric rate design that allow the opportunity to recover certain cost based on gas usage revenue from sale and transportation service are recognized in the same period in which the related volume are delivered to customer revenue from residential and certain commercial and industrial customer are recognized on the basis of scheduled meter reading additionally unbilled revenue are recognized for estimated delivery of gas not yet billed to these customer from the last bill date to the end of the accounting period for other commercial and industrial customer and for all wholesale customer revenue are based on actual delivery through the end of the period the tariff for the natural gas distribution utility include provision which allow for the recognition of certain revenue prior to the time such revenue are billed to customer these provision are referred to alternative revenue program and provide for the recognition of certain revenue prior to billing long the amount recognized will be collected from customer within month of recognition these program are follows weather normalization adjustment reduce customer bill when winter weather is colder than normal and increase customer bill when weather is warmer than normal and are included in the tariff for virginia natural gas and chattanooga gas revenue normalization mechanism mitigate the impact of conservation and declining customer usage and are contained in the tariff for virginia natural gas and nicor gas effective november and revenue true up adjustment included within the provision of the gram program in which atlanta gas light participates short term alternative to formal rate case filing the revenue true up feature provides for positive or negative adjustment to record revenue in the amount of any variance to budgeted revenue which are submitted and approved annually requirement of gram such adjustment are reflected in customer billing in subsequent program year wholesale gas servicesprior to the sale of sequent on july southern company gas netted revenue from energy and risk management activity with the associated cost profit from sale between segment were eliminated and recognized good or service sold to end use customer southern company gas recorded wholesale gas service transaction that qualified derivative southern company gas charge it utility customer for natural gas consumed using natural gas cost recovery mechanism set by the applicable state regulatory agency under these mechanism all prudently incurred natural gas cost are passed through to customer without markup subject to regulatory review southern company gas defers or accrues the difference between the actual cost of natural gas and the amount of commodity revenue earned in given period such that no operating income is recognized related to these cost the deferred or accrued amount is either billed or refunded to customer prospectively through adjustment to the commodity rate deferred and accrued natural gas cost are included in the balance sheet regulatory asset and regulatory liability respectively southern company adjustment to reduce the value of inventory to market value and gain and loss associated with certain derivative income taxesthe registrant use the liability method of accounting for deferred income tax and provide deferred income tax for all significant income tax temporary difference in accordance with regulatory requirement deferred federal itcs for the traditional electric operating company are deferred and amortized over the average life of the related property with such amortization normally applied credit to reduce depreciation and amortization in the statement of income southern power and the natural gas distribution utility deferred federal itcs well certain state itcs for nicor gas are deferred and amortized to income tax expense over the life of the respective asset under current tax law certain project at southern power related to the construction of renewable facility are eligible for federal itcs southern power estimate eligible cost which they relate to acquisition may not be finalized until the allocation of the purchase price to asset ha been finalized southern power applies the deferred method to itcs whereby the itcs are recorded deferred credit and amortized to income tax expense over the life of the respective asset furthermore the tax basis of the asset is reduced by of the itcs received resulting in net deferred tax asset southern power ha elected to recognize the tax ii table of content index to financial statementscombined note to financial statement continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reportbenefit of this basis nicor excludes afudc related to the construction of plant vogtle unit and see note under georgia power nuclear construction for additional information impairment of long lived assetsthe registrant evaluate long lived asset and finite lived intangible asset for impairment when event or change in circumstance indicate that the carrying value of such asset may not be recoverable the determination of whether an impairment ha occurred is based on either specific regulatory disallowance sale transaction price that is le than the asset group carrying value or an estimate of undiscounted future cash flow attributable to the asset group compared with the carrying value of the asset if an impairment ha occurred the amount of the impairment recognized is determined by either the amount of regulatory disallowance or by estimating the fair value of the asset and recording loss if the carrying value is greater than the fair value for asset identified held for sale the carrying value is compared to the estimated fair value le the cost to sell in order to determine if an impairment loss is required until the asset are disposed of their estimated fair value is re evaluated when circumstance or event change see note and under southern company gas and southern company leveraged lease respectively and note under southern company and southern company gas for information acquisition accountingat the time of an acquisition management will ass whether acquired asset and activity meet the definition of business for acquisition that meet the definition of business operating result from the date of acquisition are included in the acquiring entity financial statement the purchase price including any contingent consideration is allocated based on the fair value of the identifiable asset acquired and liability assumed including any intangible asset asset acquired that do not meet the definition of business are accounted for an asset acquisition the purchase price of each asset acquisition is allocated based on the relative fair value of asset acquired determining the fair value of asset acquired and liability assumed requires management judgment and management may engage independent valuation expert to assist in this process fair value are determined by using market participant assumption and typically include the timing and amount of future cash flow incurred construction cost the nature of acquired contract discount rate power market price and expected asset life any due diligence or transition cost incurred for potential or successful acquisition are expensed incurred historically contingent consideration primarily relates to fixed amount due to the seller once an acquired construction project is placed in service for contingent consideration with variable payment management fair value the arrangement with any change recorded in the statement of income see note for additional fair value information development costsfor southern power development cost are capitalized once project is probable of completion primarily based on review of it economics and operational feasibility well the status of power off take agreement and regulatory approval if applicable southern power capitalized development cost are included in cwip on the balance sheet all of southern power development cost incurred prior to the determination that project is probable of completion are expensed incurred and included in other operation and maintenance expense in the statement of income if it is determined that project is no longer probable of completion any of southern power capitalized development cost are expensed and included in other operation and maintenance expense in the statement of income long term service agreementsthe traditional electric operating company and southern power have entered into ltsas for the purpose of securing maintenance support for certain of their generating facility the ltsas cover all planned inspection on the covered equipment ii table of content index to financial statementscombined note to financial statement continued southern company and subsidiary company annual reportwhich generally includes the cost of all labor and material the ltsas also obligate the counterparties to cover the cost of unplanned maintenance on the covered equipment subject to limit and scope specified in each contract payment made under the ltsas for the performance of any planned inspection or unplanned capital maintenance are recorded in the statement of cash flow investing activity receipt of major part into material and supply inventory prior to planned inspection are treated noncash transaction in the statement of cash flow any payment made prior to the work being performed are recorded prepayment in other current asset and noncurrent asset on the balance sheet at the time work is performed an appropriate amount is accrued for future payment or transferred from the prepayment and recorded property plant and equipment or expensed transmission receivables prepaymentsas result of southern power acquisition and construction of generating facility southern power ha transmission receivables and or prepayment representing the portion of interconnection network and transmission upgrade that will be reimbursed to southern power upon completion of the related project transmission cost are
